metadata.Description: Battery recycling is the process of reusing or extracting valuable materials from used batteries to reduce waste and environmental impact.

level 1.Description: Battery recycling addresses waste management by safely disposing and recycling used batteries.
Battery recycling employs circular economy principles to minimize resource consumption and maximize recycling.
Battery recycling collaborates with electronic manufacturers to establish collection and recycling programs.
Battery recycling supports the clean energy transition by recycling batteries used in renewable energy systems.
Battery recycling administers the Battery Recycling Program to ensure proper collection and recycling of batteries.
Battery recycling measures the environmental impact of recycling processes to improve sustainability.
Battery recycling aligns with circular economy goals by promoting resource efficiency and waste reduction.
Battery recycling is an instance of sustainable waste management practices.

level 2.Subject: circular economy
level 2.Description: The circular economy implements sustainable production practices that minimize waste and maximize resource efficiency.

level 2.Subject: circular economy
level 2.Description: The circular economy focuses on waste reduction strategies to minimize the environmental impact of resource consumption.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

level 2.Subject: just energy transition
level 2.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.
